text.section: Each procurement contract shall include the following clause:

section.section: Except as provided in subparagraph (ii) of this paragraph, unless a person is a bona fide employee, bona fide salesperson, or commercial selling agency working for the contractor, the person may not offer or agree to solicit or secure a procurement contract under this subtitle if the person's fee is contingent on, or results from, the making of the procurement contract.

A regulated lobbyist, who is described in § 15-701(a)(1), (2), or (3) of the State Government Article, may not offer or agree to solicit or secure a procurement contract under this subtitle if the lobbyist's fee is contingent on, or results from, the making of the procurement contract.

Except as provided in subparagraph (ii) of this paragraph, a contractor or a person who provides architectural or engineering services may not offer to pay a fee or other consideration that is contingent on the making of a procurement contract under this article.

This paragraph does not apply to a payment to a bona fide employee, bona fide salesperson, or commercial selling agency working for the contractor or person providing architectural or engineering services.

An employee of a unit may not solicit or secure or offer to solicit or secure a procurement contract under this article between the unit and any other person for which the employee is paid or is to be paid a fee or other consideration that is contingent on the making of the procurement contract.
